rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 166b. Portrait of a Nayas woman, wrapped in an embroidered wool and wild dog's hair robe with long fringe. She is holding a painted paddle in her arm and inserted under her bottom lip is a block of wood.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Eeh-zep-ta-say-a
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs; Indian weapons
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 167. Portrait of the head chief of the Nayas tribe and distinguished warrior. He is depicted smoking a pipe and has wife him his weapons. He is wearing a long, fringed and embroidered tunic, decorated with grizzly claws. He is weaing earrings and a headdress.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Yem-ne-yen-ne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Indian women; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 168. Portrait of a young girl of the Nayas tribe. She is wrapped in an embroidered and fringed robe, wears several necklaces and earrings. She has a block of wood through her bottom lip.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Hoogst-ah-a
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Salish Indians; Clothing and dress
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 169. Portrait of the second chief of the Flathead tribe. He is depicted wrapped in a blanket.

rdf:Description.dc:title: A Flathead woman
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Salish Indians; Indian women; Indian children
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 170. Portrait of a Flathead woman carrying her child on her back in a cradle. She is wearing a shirt and is holding a fish. She is depicted ""basketing salmon on the Columbia River.""

rdf:Description.dc:title: Ya-tax-ta-coo
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Salish Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 171. Portrait of a Flathead warrior wrapped in a blanket. He is wearing several strands of beads, earrings and feathers in his hair.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Yun-ne-yow (The Green Vine that Creeps)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 172. Portrait of a young Flathead boy, dressed in his breechclout and holding his salmon bow.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Flathead woman and child
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Salish Indians; Indian women; Indian children; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 173. Portrait of a Flathead woman seated, holding her child in a cradle. This image was intended to portray the process of flattening the infant's head. Although this process was never actually practiced by the Flathead Tribe.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Hee-ohks-te-kin (the Rabbit Skin Leggins)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Salish Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs; Indian weapons; Shields; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 174. Portrait of a young warrior of the Nez Pierce band of the Flathead tribe. He is depicted wearing an embroidered animal skin robe with beaded quillwork and scalp locks. He is holding his shield and bow and arrows. He wears braids in his hair and various forms of feathers.

rdf:Description.dc:title: H'co-a-h'co-a-h'cotes-min (No Horns on His Head)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Salish Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs; Indian weapons
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 175. Portrait of a young warrior of the Nez Pierce band of the Flatheads. He is depicted here wearing a tunic with beaded embroidery, scalp locks on the sleeves and face paint. He is holding his scalping knife.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Hangs-kratch (the Sea Fog)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Arapaho Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 176. Portrait of the head chief of the Arapaho tribe. He is depicted wearing a robe made of the skin of a grizzly bear and a single feather in his hair.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Arapaho woman and child
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Indian women; Indian children; Arapaho Indians; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 177. Portrait of an Arapaho woman wrapped in a blanket and carrying her child and a basket on her back.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Too-jen-ux-ta (the Jumper)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Arapaho Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs; Indian weapons
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 178. Portrait of a famous warrior and hunter of the Arapaho tribe. He is depicted wearing full body paint, a breechclout, several strands of beads and his weapons.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Yaw-naw-pix
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Shoshoni Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 179. Portrait of a chief of the Snake tribe. He is depicted wearing the robe of a Crow chief, who he killed in a battle. He is also wearing a very long feathered headdress and face paint.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Naw-en-saw-pee (He Who Runs Up Hill)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Shoshoni Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs; Indian weapons; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 180. Portrait of a Snake warrior of distinction, wrapped in a buffalo skin robe and carrying his bow and quiver. He is wearing face paint and various forms of feathers in his hair.

rdf:Description.dc:title: On-da-woot (the Smooth Bark)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Shoshoni Indians; Clothing and dress; Indian weapons; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 181. Portrait of a Snake warrior wearing a buffalo skin robe with his bow and quiver. He is wearing full body paint and has feathers in his hair.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Tchongs-tee (the Singer)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Navajo Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs; Indian weapons
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 182. Portrait of a young Navaho warrior wearing full body paint and holding his bow and arrows. He is wearing a breechclout.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Nah-qua-sab-bee (Not Afraid)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Navajo Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs; Indian weapons; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 183. A young Navaho warrior in body paint, a breechclout and holding his bow and arrows. His hair is very long and he wears many strands of beads, a peace medal and a headdress.

rdf:Description.dc:title: A Navaho woman
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Indian women; Navajo Indians; Clothing and dress
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 184. Portrait of a Navaho woman wearing a long robe, embroidered. Her hair is worn long and loose and she wears many stands of beads.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Be-las-Oqua-na
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Apache Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 185. An Apachee chief of his band called the ""Spanish Spur"" and an accomplished warrior. He is depicted wearing a robe with painted war scenes, many strands of beads, face paint and a feathered headdress.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Nick-war-ra (the Horse Catcher)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Apache Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs; Indian weapons; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 186. Portrait of a celebrated Apachee brave in war dress and war paint. He is carrying his shielf, war club and bow.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Nah-quat-see-a
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Apache Indians; Clothing and dress; Indian weapons; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 187. Portrait of an Apache warrior dressed in a breechclout, body paint and resting on his lance.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Hu-tah
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Apache Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs; Indian weapons; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 188. Portrait a an Apachee warrior in war dress and war paint, a breechclout and his bow and quiver set.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Kee-an-ne-kuk (the Foremost Man)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Kickapoo Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 189. Chief of the Kickapoo tribe in the act of prayer. He was called also the ""Kickapoo prophet"" and is dressed in a cloth tunic with embroidered embellishments. His hair is cut short and he wears multiple strands of beads.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Ah-ton-we-tuck (the Cock Turkey)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Kickapoo Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 190. Portrait of an elderly Kickapoo man saying a prayer with his baton. He is wearing a robe, beads and his head is partially shaved.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Ah-to-wat-o-mee
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Indian women; Kickapoo Indians; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 191. Portrait of a Kickapoo woman, the wife of Kee-an-ne-kuk. She is depicted praying with the maple stick and is dressed in a buffalo skin robe.

rdf:Description.dc:title: On-saw-kie (the Sac)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Potawatomi Indians; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 192. Portrait of a young Putowotomie man, reading prayer from the maple stick. He is depicted wearing body paint, a robe and many strands of beads.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Nah-pow-sa (Bear Travelling in the Night)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Potawatomi Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 193. Portrait of a chief of the Putowotomie tribe dressed in a blouse, neckscarves, short hair adorned with various amounts of feathers.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Kee-see
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Indian women; Potawatomi Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 194. A Putowotomie woman praying with her maple stick. She is wearing a dress tied with a sash, and many strands of beads and earrings.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pah-mee-cow-e-tah (the Man Who Tracks)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Peoria Indians; Clothing and dress; Indian weapons; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 195. Portrait of an ""elegant"" young chief of the Peoria tribe. He is depicted wearing a tunic and belt, strands of beads, a short cape, a peace medal and an elaborate headdress. He holds in his hand a rifle.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Kee-mo-ra-ni-a
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Peoria Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs; Indian weapons; Tomahawks
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 196. Portrait of a young Peoria man dressed in a heavily ornamented tunic, wearing multiple strands of beads and holding a looking glass and a tomahawk. He is wearing a cloth and feather headdress, many earrings, a septum piercing and face paint.

rdf:Description.dc:title: A Peoria woman
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Indian women; Peoria Indians; Clothing and dress
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 197. Portrait of a Peoria woman dressed in a long robe, wearing many beaded necklaces, earrings and small amounts of face paint.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Kee-mon-saw (the Little Chief)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Kaskaskia Indians; Indian children; Clothing and dress
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 198. Portrait a Kaskaskia Indian in European dress. Wearing a jacket, vest, blouse and leggings. His hair is also cut short and he stands with a young child holding a bow and arrow set.

rdf:Description.dc:title: A Kaskaskia woman
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Indian women; Older Indians; Kaskaskia Indians; Clothing and dress
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 199. Portrait of an elderly Kaskaskia woman, and the mother of chiefKee-mon-saw. She is depicted wearing a dress and a robe, and many strands of beaded necklaces.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Eeh-tow-o-kaum (Both Sides of the River)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Mohegan Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 200. Portrait of the chief of the Mohigan tribe. He is holding a prayer books in one hand and a cane in the other. He is wearing a long coat and a cloth and feathered headdress or hat.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Mo-sho-la-tub-bee (He Who Puts Out and Kills)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Choctaw Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 202. Portrait of a chief of the Choctaw tribe. He is depicted seated and wearing a blouse, a large robe, many strands of beads, face paint and feathers in his hair. His hair is worn short and he holds and eagles tail fan.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Hah-choo-tuck-nee (the Snapping Turtle)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Choctaw Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 203. Portrait of a young Choctaw man. He is depicted seated, wearing a long tunic with leggings and boots. His hair is worn short, adorned with feathers and he wears a sash across hsi chest.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Stee-cha-co-me-co (the Great King)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Creek Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs; Indian weapons; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 204. Portrait of a Creek chief called ""Ben Perryman."" He is wearing a blouse, an embroidered jacket and is carrying his rifle.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Hol-te-mal-te-tez-te-neek-a ""Sam Perryman""
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Creek Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs; Indian weapons
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 205. A Creek man standing in wearing a tunic with a large sash and a cloth hat, a scarf around his neck, earrings and face paint.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Go-to-kow-pah-a (He who Stands by Himself)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Clothing and dress; Indian weapons; Tomahawks
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 206. A young warrior from the Weah tribe. He is wearing a fringed shawl, a wrist band, an animal skin robe, body and face paint, several strands of beads and a large feathered headdress. He is holding a tomahawk in his hand.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Wa-pon-je-a (The Swan)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 207. A Weah man wearing face paint, several strands of beads, a large sash, an elaborate feathered headdress, a blouse and robe. He is holding a pipe.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Men-son-se-a (The Lefthand)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Piankashaw Indians; Clothing and dress; Indian weapons
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 208. A Piankashaw warrior in a long tunic with many strands of beads, holding a war club. He is wears a wrist cuff, face paint and a cloth headdress.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Piankshaw woman
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Piankashaw Indians; Clothing and dress; Indian women; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 209. Portrait of the wife of a warrior and Piankashaw woman. She is wearing a dress many strands of beads, is holding a purse and her hair is in braids.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Nee-a-co-mo (To Fix With His Foot)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Piankashaw Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 210. A Piankashaw man wrapped in a robe. He wears face paint, several beaded necklaces and a feather in his hair.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Jol-lee
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Piankashaw Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 211. A chief of the band of the Cherokees. He wears a long European style jacket and a cloth headdress. He is holding a pipe.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Tuch-ee or ""Dutch""
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Cherokee Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 212. Portrait of a chief of a band of the Cherokee Indians, also a warrior. He wears a tunic with fringe, a large belt and carries his gun powder horn. He also wears a feathered turban, face paint and holds a rifle.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Ah-no-je-nahge (He Who Stands on Both Sides)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Sioux Indians; Rackets (Sporting goods); Manners and customs; Clothing and dress
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 213. Portrait of a Sioux ballplayer holding his racket. He wears a fringed breech clout, a feathered headdress and beaded strands. From the verso of the drawing: ""Said to be the most distinguished ballplayer in his tribe.""

rdf:Description.dc:title: Wee-chush-ta-doo-ta (The Red Man)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Ojibwa Indians; Rackets (Sporting goods); Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 214. An Ojibbeway ballplayer in his ballplayer costume and holding his racket. He wears an animal hair headdress and his hair is long.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Tullock Chish Ko (He Who Drinks the Juice of the Stone)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Choctaw Indians; Rackets (Sporting goods); Manners and customs; Clothing and dress
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 215. Portrait of a Choctaw ballplayer in his ballplayer dress and holding his ball and rackets. From the verso of the drawing: ""All ball players wear a tail of quills or other quills or other material. In this tribe the tails are uniformly made of white horse hair, and in the form represented in this picture.""

rdf:Description.dc:title: Wi-jun-jon (The Pigeon's Egghead)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Assiniboine Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 216. Portrait of a distinguised warrior of the Assiniboine tribe. He wears an embroidered tunic with scalp locks on the sleeves, a buffalo skin robe, a very long, large headdress and leggings. He carries a pipe in his hand.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Wi-jun-jon (the Pigeon's Egghead)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Assiniboine Indians; Clothing and dress; Manners and customs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Drawing No. 217. Portrait of an Assiniboine Indian in a European style jacket, carrying a fan and his weaponry.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Souvenir of the North American Indians as they were in the middle of the 19th century, 1852
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Catlin, George, 1796-1872
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Indians in art
rdf:Description.dc:description: Pencil portraits of individual North American Indians, together with penned descriptions for each in Catlin's handwriting which identify the individuals and their tribal affiliations.
rdf:Description.dc:format: 9 boxes (217 drawings and descriptions): pencil, pen and ink; 41 x 32 cm Drawings; Portraits; Works of art Tiff
rdf:Description.dc:relation: Edward E. Ayer Art Collection (Newberry Library) Edward E. Ayer Digital Collection (Newberry Library)
rdf:Description.dc:rights: All rights reserved by the Newberry Library. Permission to reproduce in any format must be requested in writing. Contact Photoduplication Department, Newberry Library, 60 W. Walton St., Chicago, IL 60610. Phone: 312-255-3566 E-mail: photoduplication@newberry.org

rdf:Description.dc:title: Sparking
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Manners and customs; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Front and back pastedowns. Front pastedown: light sketch of horse. Back pastedown: At left, courting couple share blanket. Caption: "Sparking." Warrior with bow, arrow, quiver, flap leggings, face paint, earring, and roached hair stands with his saddled horse. At far left, incomplete sketch of horse head and man's head with war bonnet. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Cheyenne has killed Pawnee
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pawnee Indians; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 001. Cheyenne warrior holds lance to Pawnee. Cheyenne has shield, war bonnet, and lance with red sashes. His horse stands to the side, decorated for battle. A yellow figure (bird?) with black saw-toothed beak flies in front of horse. Caption: ""Cheyenne has killed Pawnee."" Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Soldier, Snake scout
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Shoshoni Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Horses Snake Indians
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 002-003. Three men on horseback. At the rear, a man in black holds a rifle and throws a lance, which flies through a circle in mid-air. Many hoof prints at bottom of page. Caption: ""Soldier, Snake scout."" Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Snake Indian chase by Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Shoshoni Indians; Horses Snake Indians
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 004-005. Cheyenne warrior chases Snake Indian on horseback. Cheyenne Indian wears war bonnet, breastplate, and shield with four yellow feathers. Snake Indian attempts to shoot his pursuer with a bow and arrow. Both hold rifles. Caption: ""Snake Indian chase by Cheyenne."" Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Soldiers charging at Powder River
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Soldiers; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 006. Group of soldiers on horseback. Soldiers in grey or blue uniforms, a few with red face paint and long hair, as though altered to appear Indian. Bullets fly from rifles at front of group. Caption: ""Soldiers charging at Powder River."" Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Cheyennes repulsed and wounded
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 008. Two men and three horses with gunshot wounds stagger through bullet-ridden scene. One man wears war bonnet, the other a single feather. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Snake Indian killed (Intended for a white man)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Shoshoni Indians; Horses Snake Indians
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 011. Man with green head decoration dismounts horse to aid accidentally injured Snake Indian. Injured man lays with hat, bow and arrow, and rifle on ground, wearing U.S. military uniform. Horse stands on the left. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Snake Indian
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Shoshoni Indians; Horses Snake Indians
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 013. Two men approach each other with outstretched hands. Both wear long blue shirts. Man on left carries a gun. Man on right wears a gold necklace and holds an arrow. Horse stands to the right, with tail bundled for battle and what appears to be a scalp and feather attached to its bridle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crow Indian--Cheyenne horse wounded
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Crow Indians; Horses Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 015. Crow stands with ax (tomahawk) wound to head. Cheyenne approaches, wearing a white hooded coat (capote) and holding a rifle and his horse's rein. His hand is outstretched, as if he has just thrown the ax. Horse stands to the right with multiple gunshot wounds. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: White man, altered to Crow Indian, killed by Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 017. White man bleeds from gunshot wounds. His bow and arrow and hat are on the ground. Cheyenne on horseback holds gun. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Soldier, afterwards changed with Crow head dress
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 019. Soldier carries gun in hand and has rifle in saddle bag. He wears a pendant or medal. He is pursued by a Cheyenne with fur shirt and breastplate. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Soldier, afterwards changed with Crow head dress, pursued by Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Bow and arrow; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 021. Cheyenne warrior wears red face paint and carries brightly decorated shield. A red bird (perhaps an animal skin medicine object) is perched on his head. He chases a man on a branded horse (""M"") who holds a bow and arrow. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Cheyenne camp attacked at Powder River by soldiers (Mackenzies), Fall of 1876
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indian Wars (Cheyenne : 1876); Soldiers
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 022-023. Five soldiers in blue uniforms ride in formation. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Soldiers chased and killed
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Soldiers; Horses Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 024. Soldiers, clutching rifles, fall off their wounded horses. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Killed three soldiers (Changed to Indians and tipees built over the houses)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Soldiers; Tipis; Dwellings
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 029. Indian with a rifle approaches three men who stand outside a cluster of houses/tipis. Indian wears red sashes around neck, a bandolier, and flap leggings. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: White man killed by Cheyennes
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Horses; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 031. Two men on horseback exchange fire. White man (altered to look like Indian), wearing pendant, bleeds from wounds and mouth. Indian, on the right, wears red sash. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pawnees pursuing Cheyennes on opposite page
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Pawnee Indians; Horses; Weapons
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 032. Pawnees on foot and on horseback holding weapons, in pursuit of Cheyennes. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Cheyenne stampeding Crow horses
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 035. Cheyenne with yellow browband holds a rifle and chases colored horses. He wears a long-train war bonnet decorated with birds. His horse is decorated with a star and has its tail wrapped. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Soldiers partially altered to look like Indians
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Soldiers; Horses; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 036. Men on foot and horseback fire rifles. Caption: ""Soldiers partially altered to look like Indians."" Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Cheyenne and horse--Horse wounded
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America; Clothing and dress; Horses; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 038. Horse bleeds from head and side. Has striped saddle blanket, stirrups, and wrapped tail. Cheyenne wears long-train war bonnet decorated with birds and a yellow browband. Holds rifle and shield. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pawnee Indians; Horses; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 041. Cheyenne man on horse wears decorated tunic (scalp shirt) with fringe and feathers, necklace, and hair decoration. Pawnee man stands below holding bow and arrow, struck in the head with Cheyenne's feathered sword. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crow killed by Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Crow Indians; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 043. Cheyenne warrior on horse, with yellow fur browband, long-train war bonnet and yellow sashes on sleeves. Crow warrior with striped breech clout trampled by Cheyenne's horse. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crow Indians
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Crow Indians; Horses; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 044. Four men on horseback with rifles, wearing striped breech clouts and roached hair. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crow killed by Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Crow Indians; Horses; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 047. Crow warrior receives fatal wound from Cheyenne's lance. Crow wears striped breech clout, roached hair, and carries small sword with sash and feathers. Cheyenne has shield with animal figure, and a scalp attached to horse's bridle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Attack in 1874
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Soldiers; Horses; Wagons
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 048. Attack in 1874 on [Main] near the Washita. Escort under Major Lyman of 5th Infantry. Sketch is disfigured by attempt to change white men to Indian & the wagon [corral] is [?] an Indian village. Group of men under fire, trapped in circle of wagons. Hoof prints surround the circle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: White man (altered) killed by Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Soldiers; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 051. Cheyenne with scalp lock, gun, and animal skin quiver on horseback. Wounded white man, a soldier altered to appear Indian, has fallen off horse. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crow Indians kill Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Crow Indians; Clothing and dress; Horses; Rifles; Indian weapons
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 053. Crows attack from the left with rifles. Cheyenne warrior falls from wounded horse, with his war club and banner lance. He wears a scalp shirt decorated with a sun symbol, and a bird-shaped animal medicine object in his hair. His horse has a scalp tied to its bridle. A second wounded horse stumbles in the foreground. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pawnee killed by Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Pawnee Indians; Horses; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 055. Cheyenne on horse throws lance at standing Pawnee. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Cheyenne warrior kills enemy
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Horses; Bow and arrow; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 057. Cheyenne riding decorated horse shoots enemy with bow and arrow. Wounded man holds rifle. Cheyenne wears yellow split-horn war bonnet and yellow face paint. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Shoshone camp
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Shoshone Indians; Horses; Rifles; Villages; Tipis
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 058. Cheyenne with rifle approaches village on foot. Tipis and faces in village under fire. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Snake Indian killed
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Shoshoni Indians; Horses; Rifles; Bow and arrow Snake Indians
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 060-061. Left page (page 60): Two circular areas, surrounded by hoof prints and bullets, indicate a bloody battle. Right page (page 61): Cheyenne in sun symbol scalp shirt, long war bonnet decorated with birds, and single-horn headband attacks Snake Indian amid barrage of bullets. Cheyenne also holds a rifle, while Snake has rifle and bow and arrow. Cheyenne's horse has feather and scalp tied to its bridle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: The Man of house is opposite house
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Horses; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 062. Man in overcoat lays face-down with gun in right hand. Another gun floats in mid-air, pointed at his temple. He wears a US-military style hat with three feathers added. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: White man in house
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Pioneers; Horses; Rifles; Dwellings
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 065. Afterwards disfigured. Two men struggling with rifle, drawn inside a box (house). One, in overcoat and tophat, has been altered to appear ""Indian."" Horse stands outside. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Originally intended for Black Hills
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Horses; Indian weapons
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 067. One man on horseback kills four armed enemies (altered to appear Indian) with a forked instrument or lance. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crow trampled by Cheyenne's horse
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Crow Indians; Horses; Indian weapons
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 069. Cheyenne with saber and military coat, on horseback, tramples Crow who is shooting arrows. Second Crow, on horseback, fires rifle at Cheyenne. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Horse wounded
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Pioneers; Horses; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 070-071. Horse stumbles, bleeding from mouth. Many hoof prints. (page 70) ""White hunter"" aims rifle at Cheyenne on horse. (page 71) Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: First meant for soldier
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Soldiers; Horses; Rifles; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 073. Cheyenne on horse with yellow sash and blanket. Bird-shaped medicine object on horse's tail. Soldier stands with bow; upside-down rifle at chin. Horse has been shot in neck. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crow Indian
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Crow Indians; Horses; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 074. Two men on horseback fire rifles ahead. Two incomplete characters (heads only) stand to the side. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Horses; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 075. Man with long war bonnet, shield with otter tails or feathers, yellow browband, and crooked lance walks in front of horse. Horse has tail tied, saddle blanket, and scalp attached to bridle. Bullets fly. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: First meant for white man
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pioneers; Horses; Lances; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 077. Indian on green horse with shield and banner lance attacks white man, who holds bow and arrow. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Repulsed in the attack
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Horses; Tipis; Dwellings
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 078 and 081. Indians on opposite page repulsed in the attack. Pencil drawing of two houses, altered to look like tipis. (page 78) Two men on horseback ride through bullets. First man falls off wounded horse. He has a shield with a long train of otter tails or feathers. (page 81) Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Soldiers changed to Crow Indians
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Crow Indians; Soldiers; Horses; Rifles; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 082-083. Cheyenne gets the gun from one and kills him. Two men grapple for rifle as horse looks on. (page 82) Four soldiers lay dead with bows and arrows on ground. (page 83) Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Black Horse Ledger
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Pioneers; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 085. White man. Cheyenne rides up behind man on horse, shooting him with a gun. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pawnee
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Pawnee Indians; Horses; Lances; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 087. Cheyenne on horse attacks one Pawnee with lance, and tramples another. Both Pawnees hold bows and arrows. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Three hunters killed
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Horses; Bow and arrow; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 089. Cheyenne, dismounted from horse, shoots three hunters with his bow. He wears an animal skin quiver with long tails. The hunters are drawn in a circle and hold rifles. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pawnee man, Pawnee women--all killed by Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Pawnee Indians; Horses; Rifles; Indian weapons
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 091. Cheyenne kills five women and one man with decorated sword. He wears a white hooded coat and holds a rifle while on horseback. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Elk
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Hunting; Elk; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 093. Native American on horseback chases elk buck. He has a rope tied around his wrist, perhaps a whip or lasso. Elk has lines around its chest, as though lassoed. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Cheyenne horse
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Pawnee Indians; Horses; Rifles; Clothing and dress
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 094-95. Horse looks on while Cheyenne kills seven Pawnees with rifle. Cheyenne wears war bonnet. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Mountain lion quiver
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Horses; Shields; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 097. Man on horse with colorful shield and quiver made of mountain lion skin shoots man with bow and arrow. Victim wears white capote, sashes, roached hair, and holds lance. Black Horse glyph at top of page. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crow Indian, Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Crow Indians; Horses; Shields
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 099. Cheyenne with shield, mountain lion quiver, and long blanket approaches Crow camouflaged among plants. Crow wears pendant, striped shirt, and roached hair. A third man lays on the ground while a horse looks on. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pawnee scout
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pawnee Indians; Horses; Rifles; Swords
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 101. Cheyenne on horse, with hat and holster, attacks Pawnee scout holding rifle. Cheyenne's sword is decorated with long sashes and feathers. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Attack on Pawnee at village
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Cheyenne art; Horses; Rifles; Tipis; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 103. Pawnee holding rifle stands amid tipis. Cheyenne, wearing split horn war bonnet, U.S. military coat, and bird-shaped medicine object, attacks with banner lance. Horse looks on. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Attack on Snake village
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Shoshoni Indians; Horses; Tipis; Bow and arrow; Rifles Snake Indians
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 104-105. Many hoof- and footprints among tipis (page 104). Cheyenne, wearing U.S. military coat, attacks Snake men and woman (labelled ""squaw"") with bow and arrow. Two men fight hand-to-hand as rifle lays on ground. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Snake squaw killed
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Shoshoni Indians; Indian women; Horses; Indian weapons; Bow and arrow Snake Indians
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 107. Woman holds ax or tomahawk and carries blanket. Man wearing white capote and animal skin quiver attacks her with bow and arrow. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pawnee chased across the river and killed by Cheyenne, has on blanket coat with hood attached (winter)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Horses; Bow and arrow; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 113. Two men near river. They wear identical coats. One man, wounded, kneels with bow and arrow. Standing man hits him with butt of rifle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pawnee men attack Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America; Pawnee Indians; Horses; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 114-115. Page 114: Cheyenne with mountain lion quiver falls off horse, wounded by arrows. Two Pawnee men stand to side with bows and arrows. Page 115: Five horses run behind. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Two Pawnee men killed
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Pawnee Indians; Clothing and dress; Horses; Shields; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 116. Cheyenne on horseback tramples Pawnee. Cheyenne has bird-shaped medicine object on head, silver hair ornament, decorated shield, and lance. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crow attacked
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Crow Indians; Horses; Shields; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 118. Same Cheyenne warrior from page 116-7, with decorated shield and bird-shaped medicine object on head, attacks Crow Indian with lance. Crow aims gun at Cheyenne. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: White hunter attacked
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pioneers; Horses; Rifles; Indian weapons War bonnets
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 120. Cheyenne warrior in scalp shirt, long train war bonnet, single horned headband with bird-shaped medicine object, and yellow browband. He strikes a white hunter holding rifle (altered to appear Indian) with his war club. Cheyenne's horse has tail tied for battle and a scalp attached to bridle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Soldier attacked by Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Soldiers; Horses; Lances War bonnets
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 122. Cheyenne warrior with long train war bonnet and horned headband attacks soldier with lance. ""Soldier partly changed to look like Indian."" Soldier shoots rifle at Cheyenne, wounding horse. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: White scout
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Scouting (Reconnaissance); Horses; Rifles; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 124. Cheyenne on horseback strikes white scout on head with lash. Scout (altered to look like Indian) holds rifle. Cheyenne holds rifle in left hand and striking weapon in right. Has quiver made of animal skin. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: White hunter attacked
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Horses; Lances; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 126. Cheyenne on spotted horse, with shield, quiver, and bird-shaped medicine object, attacks with lance. White hunter, altered to appear Indian, holds rifle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: White hunter attacked
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Horses; Hunters; Lances; Firearms
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 129. Cheyenne on horseback attacks hunter with lance. Hunter (changed to look Native American) holds a pistol, his rifle and beaver skin pouch laying on the ground. Cheyenne wears fringed shirt, yellow face paint, and shield. His horse is decorated for battle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Running off cavalry horses, from Fort Dodge
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--WArs; Cavalry horses; Horses; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 130-131. Man holding rifle rides among six horses, some bridled or branded. One horse turns to look behind. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Snake Indian attacked at river
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Shoshoni Indians; Horses; Shields
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 132. Snake Indian falls, wounded, near river. He wears a blue pendant. Cheyenne on horse has shield with train of feathers or otter skins, and attacks Snake man with sword decorated with split otter skin. Horse is decorated for battle, including bird-shaped object on tail. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Hunter attacked near creek
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Horses; Hunters; Bow and arrow; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 134. White hunter, bow and arrow lying nearby, flies through air (upside-down) upon being hit by Cheyenne's lance. Cheyenne has blue marks on face, like tears. Horse decorated for battle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pawnees attacked by Cheyenne
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pawnee Indians; Horses; Lances; Bow and arrow
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 136-137. Cheyenne with decorated shield attacks three Pawnees with banner lance. Pawnees armed with bows and arrows, one with animal skin quiver. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pawnee attacked
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pawnee Indians; Horses; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 138. Cheyenne on decorated horse attacks Pawnee with lance. Both have animal skin quivers. Horse wounded. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pawnee attacked
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pawnee Indians; Horses; Lances; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 140. Cheyenne on horse, carrying shield with long train of feathers or otter skins, attacks Pawnee with lance. Pawnee aims rifle, has red face paint and beaver skin pouch. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pawnee attacked
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pawnee Indians; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 144. Pawnee falls as he is wounded by Cheyenne's lance. Cheyenne has shield and banner lance with round decoration at the tip (scalp?). His face has painted lines on chin, cheek, and below eye (like tears). His horse is decorated for battle, including a scalp tied to its bridle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: White man partially changed to Indian
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Horses; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 146. As white man walks, Cheyenne points lance to his back. Cheyenne wears military coat and silver hair ornament. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pawnee squaw
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pawnee Indians; Indian women; Horses; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 148. Pawnee woman attacked by Cheyenne on horse. Cheyenne has lance and silver hair ornament. Horse decorated for battle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crow squaw
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Crow Indians; Indian women; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 150. Cheyenne with red blanket and silver armbands counts coup on Crow woman, using a forked whip-like instrument (coup stick). Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Snake Indian
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Horses; Shoshoni Indians
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 152. Cheyenne with red blanket and silver armbands counts coup on Snake Indian, using forked instrument (coup stick). Snake man has gold bracelets and shield decorated with feathers. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Snake Indian
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Shoshoni Indians; Horses; Rifles; Shields; Indian weapons Snake Indians
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 155. Snake Indian, wearing red breech clout, animal skin pouch, and holding rifle, struggles with Cheyenne. Cheyenne has animal skin (mountain lion?) quiver and shield with animal design and feathers. Cheyenne strikes Snake with forked instrument. Horse stands to side. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: White man attacked
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Soldiers; Horses; Rifles; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 158. White man in military coat, altered to look like Indian, drops rifle as he is stabbed by Cheyenne on horse. Cheyenne has yellow face paint, silver armbands, red necklace, scalp lock, and crooked lance. The white man's horse has been wounded. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Pawnee
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pawnee Indians; Horses; Bow and arrow; Firearms
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 161. Cheyenne wears armbands, breastplate, red and yellow face paint and carries banner lance while on horseback. He shoots a pistol at Pawnee standing with quiver. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crooked lance
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pawnee Indians; Horses; Lances; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 165. Cheyenne with yellow and red face paint, necklace, feather on headband, and beaded pants aims crooked lance at Pawnee. Pawnee holds rifle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: White man changed to Pawnee
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indian; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pioneers; Horses; Firearms
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 166. White man pursued by Cheyenne, both on horseback. Both hold pistols; white man turns to look at Cheyenne, pendant flying. White man wounded. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: First intended for white man
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Horses; Bow and arrow; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 167. White man, altered to look like Indian, holds bow as he is attacked by Cheyenne on horseback. Cheyenne carries lance and shield with bird design and many feathers. He has red paint and other decorations on face. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: First intended for white men in wagons
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Pioneers; Horses; Shields; Rifles; Wagons
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 173. Afterwards changed to appear like Indians and wheels changed to shields. White men in wagons (now changed as indicated) fire rifles at approaching Cheyenne. Cheyenne wears war bonnet, scalp lock and cape. He returns fire with his pistol. His horse is decorated for battle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Cheyennes
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 174. Two men riding horses. One has cluster of feathers, fringed pants, and hair tied with decorations. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crooked lance
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Shields; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 177. White man falls as Cheyenne rides up with lance. Cheyenne as red and yellow face paint, armbands, and crooked lance with bead and feather decorations. His horse is decorated for battle. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Soldier, head partially changed like Indian
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Soldiers; Rifles; Lances
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 178. Soldier with rifle turns as he is attacked by Cheyenne. Cheyenne carries shield with long train, armbands, and lance. Both men on horseback. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Dance
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Dance; Rites and ceremonies; Clothing and dress; Horses War bonnets
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 180-181. Page 180: Five men with feather bundles, scalp locks, and red breech clouts follow man on horse. Man on horse wears long-train war bonnet, yellow browband, horned headband, necklance, and beaded pants. He holds one arm outstretched while the other holds his sword. His horse has scalp tied to bridle and tail decorated. Page 181: Man with long-train war bonnet leads line of four men with arms linked. Behind them, a man on a horse wears long-train war bonnet, yellow browband, and balances sword decorated with otter skin. His horse has scalp tied to bridle, tail wrapped, and ears clipped. Behind, a man with armbands, war bonnet, and otter skins carries a bundle of feathers. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Courting a girl who has a war bonnet on
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indian women; Manners and customs; Clothing and dress; Horses War bonnets
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 183. Man and woman stand wrapped in blanket, both with red face paint. Woman wears war bonnet and browband. To the side, another man wears war bonnet, horned headband, yellow browband and holds sword decorated with skins and feathers. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: War party coming home
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Rites and ceremonies; Clothing and dress; Horses; Lances; Swords War bonnets
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 184-185. Six men on horseback (two on one horse) with long-train war bonnets, banner lances, lances, swords decorated with skins, and shields. Horses decorated for battle, some with scarves or scalps tied to bridles. Some horses wounded. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crow Indian horse
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Clothing and dress; Crow Indians; Horses; Rifles
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 186-187. Crow's horse staggers, wounded, followed by Cheyenne on horseback. Cheyenne wears split horn headband, long train war bonnet, and animal skin quiver. His horse also wounded. Crow man kneels behind, aiming rifle. Another Cheyenne on horse follows him. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Snake Indian
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indians of North America--Wars; Shoshoni Indians; Horses; Shields; Bow and arrow; Lances Snake Indians
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 188. Cheyenne on horse tramples Snake man holding bow. Cheyenne holds shield with bird design and aims bent lance at Snake's three horses. Front horse is branded and has feathers in mane. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Dance--Courting
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Dance; Manners and customs; Clothing and dress; Tomahawks
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 190. At left, two men dancing with face paint, feathers, beads, leg bands. One holds tomahawk. At right, ""squaw"" and man share blanket. Farther right, solitary figure wrapped in blanket is ""too late."" Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Courting
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indian women; Manners and customs; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 191. Man and woman stand wrapped in blankets. They seem to share a decorated belt. Unfinished sketch of horse in background. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Two squaws
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indian women; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 192. Two women on one horse, with long hair and striped blankets over legs. A man on horseback approaches them. Several colored scribbles on horse. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Sparking scene
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Manners and customs; Clothing and dress; Horses
rdf:Description.dc:description: End pastedown. Three figures draped in red blankets stand under a blue parasol. One wears fringed leggings, and one wears a multicolored striped blanket. Horse with saddle blanket looks on. Drawn in different combinations of crayon pencil, crayon, and graphite pencil.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Black Horse ledger
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Cheyenne art; Cheyenne Indians; Indian Wars (Cheyenne : 1876)
rdf:Description.dc:format: 192, [2] p.: chiefly col. ill.; 40 x 17 cm Ledger drawings; Drawings; Ledgers (account books); Works of art Tiff
